{{Wireless embedded system |brand=Netgear |model=DGND4000 |revision= |upc=606449086478 |ean= |asin=B009SPNO1K |price= |est_release_date=10/18/2012 |fcc_date=09/17/2012 |manuf_country=China |manuf=SerComm |manuf_model= |manuf_rev= |availability= |type=wireless router,dsl modem |fcc_id=PY312100194 |ic_id= |pwr_v=12 |pwr_amp=5 |pwr_conn=barrel |pwr_barrel_inner= |pwr_barrel_outer= |pwr_barrel_len= |pwr_vac= |pwr_ac_hz= |pwr_pol= |pwr_poe= |cpu1_brand=Broadcom |cpu1_model=BCM6361 |cpu1_cspeed=400 |cpu2_brand= |cpu2_model= |cpu2_cspeed= |fla1=32 |fla1_brand= |fla1_model= |fla1_num= |fla2=128 |fla2_brand= |fla2_model= |fla2_num= |ram1=128 |ram1_brand=Nanya |ram1_model=NT5TU64M16DG-AC |ram1_num= |ram2= |ram2_brand= |ram2_model= |ram2_num= |expansion_if_types=USB 2.0 |expansion_pcmcia_num= |expansion_expresscard_num= |expansion_minipci_num= |expansion_minipcie_num= |expansion_usb_num=2 |jtag= |serial= |wi1_module= |wi1_module_if= |wi1_chip1_brand=Broadcom |wi1_chip1_model=BCM6361 |wi1_chip2_brand= |wi1_chip2_model= |wi1_chip3_brand= |wi1_chip3_model= |wi1_802dot11_protocols=bgn |wi1_ant_conn= |wi1_txchains=2 |wi1_rxchains=2 |wi1_sstreams=2 |wi2_module= |wi2_module_if= |wi2_chip1_brand=Broadcom |wi2_chip1_model=BCM4331 |wi2_chip2_brand= |wi2_chip2_model= |wi2_chip3_brand= |wi2_chip3_model= |wi2_802dot11_protocols=an |wi2_ant_conn=U.FL |wi2_txchains=3 |wi2_rxchains=3 |wi2_sstreams=3 |eth_none= |eth_cpu=true |eth_chip1_brand= |eth_chip1_model= |eth_chip2_brand= |eth_chip2_model= |eth_chip3_brand= |eth_chip3_model= |sw_cpu= |sw_brand=Broadcom |sw_model= |lan_speed=1G |lan_ports=4 |wan_ports=1 |flags=ADSL2+ |tp_firmware= |802dot11_protocols=abgn |default_ssid= |default_ssid_regex= |default_ip=192.168.0.1 |default_user=admin |default_pass=password |oui= |oui_eth= |default_ch= }} ''N750 Wireless Dual Band Gigabit ADSL Modem Router''
[http://www.netgear.com/home/products/wirelessrouters/high-performance/DGND4000.aspx Product page]
{{SupportPage|vendor=NETGEAR|model=DGND4000}} "AGP00B-1.6" is silkscreened on the board in the FCC photos. Per the FCC photos, this device is using... *BCM6361UKFEBG WiSoC *BCM4331KMLG 5GHz radio **three [http://www.skyworksinc.com/Product.aspx?ProductID=970 '''Skyworks''' ( / '''SiGe''') SE5004L / 5004L 5GHz power amplifier ICs] *a NT5TU64M16DG-AC (probably) RAM chip The default SSID patterns are likely '''NETGEARXX''' (2.4GHz) and '''NETGEARXX-5G''' (5GHz), where '''XX''' is a ''randomly'' generated number. Possible 4C:60:DE OUI (in '''NETGEAR''''s manual) US: 5NHDL01BDGND4000
